item.title: Route
item.description: .marker { display: block; border: none; border-radius: 50%; cursor: pointer; padding: 0; } .mapboxgl-popup { max-width: 400px; font: 16px 'Lora', serif; } .

item.title: Crew
item.description: We're a family of five traveling around the world in a Catana 401 named Vite & Rêves. You can translate this name as Fast & Dreams, but it's also pronounced the same way as ‘Vis tes rêves’ — Live your dreams.

item.title: Vite & Rêves
item.description: Sailing the Catana 401 shows her to be very fast with frank accelerations. She is easy to handle, both under sail and with motors. The gentle steering and comfort make it possible to be at the helm for long hours without fatigue.

item.title: Tangier Part 2
item.description: We're stuck in Tangier because of the wind but we're enjoying the vacation.

item.title: Tangier
item.description: We're taking a rest in Tangier.

item.title: Bye Europe, Hello Africa
item.description: We cross the strait of Gibraltar and arrive in one piece in Tangier.

item.title: The Push
item.description: Part 2 of our push out of the Med.

item.title: Sinterklaas Evening
item.description: We spend a few lost days in Almeria

item.title: Broad Reach
item.description: We sail the whole day on a broad reach before a storm

item.title: Meeting People
item.description: We meet new people on Cartagena marina's weekly barbecue.

item.title: Cartagena
item.description: We visit Cartagena while we're waiting for a good wind.

item.title: De Properste Week
item.description: Geen gezeul met vuil wasgoed door de stad, een heerlijk warme douche wanneer we dat wilden en een toilet doorspoelen met een simpele druk op de knop. Kijk, dat maakte mij ontzettend goedgemutst.

item.title: Fishy Business
item.description: We evade a fish farm on the short trip from Gorguel Bay to Cartagena, straight into the wind.

item.title: Regaining Our Sea Legs
item.description: We leave Alicante for Cartagena on a windy but quiet sea.

item.title: Waiting in Alicante
item.description: We get stuck by a storm in Alicante and explore the town some more.

item.title: Birthday
item.description: We celebrate my birthday in Alicante. My brother made a surprise appearance.

item.title: Meet the Parents
item.description: We have a super nice sailing day to Alicante, where we meet up with my parents.

item.title: Calpe
item.description: We spend a day in forgettable Calpe.

item.title: Reaching the Mainland
item.description: A strong breeze on the beam hurtles us from Ibiza to Calpe

item.title: Santa Eulària Des Riu
item.description: We visit the lovely town of Santa Eulària Des Riu and spend the night on the other side of the island.

item.title: Party Flight
item.description: Vite & Rêves flies at top speed towards Ibiza, the party island.

item.title: Hide and Seek
item.description: We play hide and seek with the storm systems of the western Mediterranean

item.title: A Simple Plan
item.description: During the crossing from Menorca to Mallorca, the genua sheet breaks.

item.title: Crossing to Menorca
item.description: We cross from Sardinia to Menorca. It was wild but went okay.

item.title: Waiting for a Window
item.description: We wait a couple of days for a good weather window to make the crossing to Menorca.

item.title: Hunkering Down
item.description: We're hunkering down for the storm. Maurice, the captain of Ikigai, proves to be a veritable goldmine of Pacific Ocean knowledge.

item.title: Finding Shelter
item.description: We go a little more westward to hunker down for the coming storm

item.title: Flying south
item.description: We fly a bit further south and give Véronique a small taste of open sea sailing.

item.title: Nora / Out of Gas
item.description: We visit the most important archeological site in Sardinia and go on a quest for gas.

item.title: Bay Sail
item.description: We made a short sail in the bay of Cagliari to Pula/Nora

item.title: Cagliari Part 2
item.description: We spent a few hours provisioning and the rest of the day discovering Cagliari's old town.

item.title: Cagliari
item.description: We meet up with Véronique in the industrial port of Cagliari

item.title: Motorcrossing
item.description: We cross the Tyrrhenian sea to Sardinia, sadly largely on engine.

item.title: Anchor Bender
item.description: Fixing a bent anchor and provisioning between thunderstorms

item.title: Weather Turning
item.description: Following winds clash at the end of the day with another weather system, bringing a huge thunderstorm.

item.title: Nightly Joyride
item.description: A very calm day ended with an exhilarating joyride past Palermo.

item.title: Chasing Zephyrs
item.description: We spent a day chasing very light winds, without much success.

item.title: Calm Milazzo
item.description: Milazzo castle was closed, so we found a big supermarket and motor a bit in the right direction.

item.title: Scylla and Charybdis
item.description: We dodge traffic in the Strait of Messina and safely pass Scilla and Charybdis.

item.title: Easy Strait
item.description: A slow spinnaker sail thorugh Messina Strait

item.title: The Perfect Sail
item.description: A late leave turns into the perfect sailing day. So perfect I couldn't stop and pulled and all-nighter.

item.title: Nice Swim / Upwind Rollercoaster
item.description: A pleasant morning spent swimming followed by a rollercoaster afternoon with 40 knots close hauled sailing.

item.title: The Longest Day
item.description: A long crossing turned into an upwind slog at night. We dodged gas platforms before arriving in Crotone.

item.title: Siesta, Signore
item.description: We're trying to get things done. Siesta got in the way.

item.title: Laundry Day
item.description: We found a laundromat and made the most of it thanks to laundromat regular Pascuale

item.title: Across The Adriatic
item.description: We cross the Adriatic Sea to Italy on a fast clip.

item.title: Resting Day
item.description: We took a day of rest and provisioning in Palaiokastrita before our crossing to Italy

item.title: Front Surfing
item.description: We anchored too close to another boat and had to leave for Corfu. The day was sharply divided in a nice spinnaker sail and an exhilarating surf down thunderstorm waves.

item.title: Making Water
item.description: A windless day saw us motoring all the way to Antipaxoi island where we had to try a few bays before finding one that would hold us safely.

item.title: In Odysseus' Footsteps
item.description: We discovered the palace of Odysseus on the island of Ithaki after a very early forced start in the morning.

item.title: Thunderstuck
item.description: We got stuck in Agios Nikolaos. There were thunderstorms all around us all day long. It rained. Our berth became untenable due te the heavy swell.

item.title: Shipwreck Beach
item.description: No visit to Zakynthos would be complete without a stop at Shipwreck Beach. Getting away from there proved… challenging.

item.title: A Fast Run
item.description: A close-hauled sail took us to Zakythos.

item.title: Deserted Katakolo
item.description: We are stuck for a day in the eery town of Katakolo. We did meet a nice local who sold us vegetables straight from his garden.

item.title: A Bit Of Everything
item.description: We encountered several waterspouts on the way to Zakynthos. Due to a 360 degree wind shift, we ended up in Katakolo.

item.title: On Achieving Calm
item.description: After a tricky start, we ended up in the delightful, quiet bay of Panagoula.

item.title: Tight Sailing
item.description: We ended up in Pylos but there was no room for us in the marina.

item.title: Koroni Castle
item.description: We visited the huge castle of Koroni.

item.title: No Time To Waste
item.description: We saw a dolphin on the way to Koroni.

item.title: Wing And Wing
item.description: We set sail for the very relaxed village of Geralimena.

item.title: Rounding Cape Maleas
item.description: We rounded cape Maleas and dropped anchor at Elafonisos beach.

item.title: Alle begin is moeilijk
item.description: Het is al ruim een week geleden dat we startten aan dit zotte avontuur. De halve wereld rond, met ons vijven, op onze catamaran ‘Vite & Rêves’.

item.title: Uncooperative Winds
item.description: We set sail for the island of Kythira but ended up in the tiny industrial port of Velanidia.

item.title: Medieval Monemvasia
item.description: We visited the very beautiful medieval city of Monemvasia.

item.title: Gale Sailing
item.description: We set sail for Monemvasia and arrived in a Gale, just before a thunderstorm broke loose.

item.title: Relaxing At Vlychada Bay
item.description: Vlychada bay was so nice we decided to stay for a day.

item.title: No Wind
item.description: We set sail for Monemvasia but didn't make it because the wind died completely. We discovered a paradisiacal bay though!

item.title: Kissed The Quay
item.description: The wind picked up so much that our anchor didn't hold. We reanchored and visited Vlychos beach.

item.title: A Fond Farewell
item.description: We maved the Vite & Rêves to the lovely Hydra port and said goodbye to the Parents.

item.title: Lazy Line Troubles
item.description: A rocky start turned into a great sailing day.

item.title: Shopping And Provisioning
item.description: We moved the boat to Lavrion port and went Ikea shopping.

item.title: Started In Lavrion
item.description: We're getting ready to leave for our world trip. We took 5 small suitcases and 2 big ones of clothes and stuff, 3 kids and 2 Parents with us. The Parents will travel back at the end of the week.

item.title: We Have A Boat!
item.description: We bought a boat and did a shake-down cruise in August. It was glorious!
